column4: what is the best way to compare two huge directories (with hundreds of subdirs) to find files that exist in the other but dont in the other?
I've been trying to ls -R > .txt and diff them but it doesn't seem to work very well
Also check out meld diff viewer.
I'm quite fond of it for some kinds of tasks... I generally shun such GUI toys, but for complex file diffs, it's a godsend.
